title: Can I prove that I don't exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can I prove that I don't exist? No, I cannot! 1) If I attempt to prove anything, I must exist in the first place.If I do not exist, I cannot do anything.Ask yourself:  Can you ride a bicycle if you do not exist?Of course not: You can only ride a bicycle if you exist. 2) You cannot prove a negative.Thus, you cannot prove that you do not exist.Of course, you can try to prove that you do exist (a positive).However, you better come up with something new, because that question has already be answered by René Descartes with Cogito ergo sum. Please let me know if I am wrong.If you really do not exist, I would like to hear from you!

At present no, you exist is a virtual reality, and relativity , once you cross this boundary you can prove you are not existing , bcz beyond the boundary nothingness existing and merge in nothingness.
No.  The only certain, unquestionable truth is, "I think therefore I am."  If you can think this question, you exist.

If someone answered this then they would be answering it and not you so even in the literal answering of your question the answer is no.  But to further the conversation an example could be like you are a dream or something?
Yes,Matter exists in Nothing (They call it space)Since Something can never exist in Nothing, Matter Does not exist.Hence You , me and quora does not exist.
This is a nonexistent answer to a nonexistent question written by a nonexistent person. Welcome to the matrix. I hope this helps.
It would be more fun to become a solipsist. Then you would only have to ask yourself!Solipsism
I hate to break this to you: you don't exist. Not in my universe you don't.
